page.title: 02LITTLEBURY
page.content: Littlebury is a small village with a {population}of approximately 350 people .The main landcover is residential with a public playing field,a foodstore/ post office,a police station, a telephone box,a bus stop/service and a{church}with a vicarage.There used to be 3 public houses in the village,but now there is only 1,"The Queen's Head" .There used to be a library in the High Street but now it is no longer there.On average 30-40 people attend the church on a regular basis,nearly 10% of the population ,which is quite a good congregation by any standards. The church was origionally built in the 14th Century,but since then parts of it have either been renovated or rebuilt.Although quite old,the church is not the oldest building in Littlebury.
